name.cantanima.chineseremainderclock

Class CRC_View

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • name.cantanima.chineseremainderclock.CRC_View
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.SharedPreferences.OnSharedPreferenceChangeListener, android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.View.OnClickListener, android.view.View.OnTouchListener, android.widget.AdapterView.OnItemSelectedListener, android.widget.CompoundButton.OnCheckedChangeListener, android.widget.TextView.OnEditorActionListener

    public class CRC_View
extends android.view.View
implements android.view.View.OnTouchListener, android.widget.CompoundButton.OnCheckedChangeListener, android.view.View.OnClickListener, android.widget.AdapterView.OnItemSelectedListener, android.widget.TextView.OnEditorActionListener, android.content.SharedPreferences.OnSharedPreferenceChangeListener
    Custom View for a Chinese Remainder Clock In order to facilitate modularity without replacing the view every time, drawing the view is subcontracted to the Clock_Drawer class. Now, that is an abstract class, so you'll need to look at its numerous descendants to see the details of how and why things are drawn the way they are. Meanwhile, this view coordinates the listening for pretty much every user interface action that isn't either a system action (e.g., dismissal, moving between activities, or menu response -- for menu response see Chinese_Remainder).

      Determines the height and width of a CRC_View: this forces it to be square, and fits it into the allowed space given by widthSpec and heightSpec.

      Interface requires me to implement this, but nothing needs doing.

      Handle a change to the preferences files.
      protected void onSizeChanged(int w, int h, int oldw, int oldh)
      If the size changes for whatever reason (and I can't think of a reason it would, aside from startup or orientation change) this forces the drawers to recalculate drawing information.
      boolean onTouch(android.view.View v, android.view.MotionEvent event)
      Show or hide buttons, enable dragging.
      void pause_animation()
      Pauses the animation of the clock.
      void restart_animation_by_calendar()
      Restarts (if not already started) the animation and sets the time guide to CALENDAR.

      Used to control the animation.

        onDetachedFromWindow in class android.view.View

      • onDraw

        protected void onDraw(android.graphics.Canvas canvas)
        Typically, this would be a very long and difficult-to-decipher method. I have opted to subcontract this to six (or more) long and difficult-to-decipher classes.
        Overrides:
        onDraw in class android.view.View
        Parameters:
        canvas - where to draw it
        See Also:
        Clock_Drawer

      • onSizeChanged

        protected void onSizeChanged(int w,
                             int h,
                             int oldw,
                             int oldh)
        If the size changes for whatever reason (and I can't think of a reason it would, aside from startup or orientation change) this forces the drawers to recalculate drawing information.
        Overrides:
        onSizeChanged in class android.view.View
        Parameters:
        w - width
        h - height
        oldw - old width
        oldh - old height

      • set_offset

        public void set_offset(float offset)
        Used to control the animation.
        See Also:
        CRC_Animation

      • setPrefs

        void setPrefs(android.content.SharedPreferences prefs,
              boolean hour_12_24,
              boolean show_seconds,
              boolean show_time,
              boolean saved_unit_orientation,
              int which_drawer,
              int bg_color,
              int line_color,
              int hour_color,
              int minute_color,
              int second_color)
        Sets the default values for certain fields
        Parameters:
        prefs - no longer needed; we should remove this
        hour_12_24 - whether we are using a 12-hour or a 24-hour clock
        show_seconds - whether to show the seconds
        show_time - whether to display the time in conventional format
        saved_unit_orientation - whether to keep put minutes inside/left of hours
        which_drawer - which @link{Clock_Drawer} to use
        bg_color - clock's background color
        line_color - clock's line color (when appropriate)
        hour_color - color used to draw objects that represent the current hour
        minute_color - color used to draw objects that represent the current minute
        second_color - color used to draw objects that represent the current second

      • setButtonsToListen

        void setButtonsToListen(android.widget.Switch pb,
                        android.widget.Button dn,
                        android.widget.Button up,
                        android.widget.Spinner spin,
                        android.widget.EditText vb,
                        android.widget.LinearLayout ll)
        Buttons we need to listen to in order to implement manual mode.
        Parameters:
        pb - "pause button", currently labeled "Manual" because that's how we use it
        dn - decrement the time (Manual mode)
        up - increment the time (Manual mode)
        spin - which time unit to modify (Manual mode)
        vb - specify a specific value for the time unit (Manual mode)

      • pause_animation

        public void pause_animation()
        Pauses the animation of the clock. Does not change any related flags; it ONLY pauses the animation.

      • restart_animation_by_calendar

        public void restart_animation_by_calendar()
        Restarts (if not already started) the animation and sets the time guide to CALENDAR.

      • move_time_to

        public void move_time_to(int h,
                         int m)
        Moves the clock to h hours, m minutes, then pauses the animation. If the animation is not already paused, it will be after this method completes.
        Parameters:
        h - hours on the clock
        m - minutes on the clock
